file_content.text: The admiral's waiting, sir.
Three following. Blasters and flame projectors.
All right. Keep them at a distance.
Sir! Enemies in pursuit. More expected. Bit of a nightmare, but we'll hold them off.
What happened to the admiral?
Where's Davos?
Status report, Ensign!
I expected you to be dead by now.
I'm surprised you're alive...
That's a horrible thing to say. Especially when we're not done yet.
Admiral Davos and his hoard should be down that corridor somewhere. Quite possibly with his escort.
Eleven--twelve more. Marauders and Scourge.
Aristocra Saganu is holding our escape route outside. We'll keep the pirates off your back. Do what you came to do.
Sir. Time to take on Admiral Davos.
Situation under control. What happened with the meeting?
They cut a deal, sir. The pirates are going to escort Admiral Davos to his treasure.
But they outlined their route. I think we know where they're heading.
Admiral Davos can't leave this planet with his hoard. Understood?
I have to intercept them.
Yes, sir.
That Republic shuttle he talked about--did it come up again?
He mentioned the Starbreeze...
Just the part about it being "full of secrets." I think the admiral likes playing games.
A little more time, and I could've shot them through the wall.
I should've killed them.
I doubt it would've helped.
The aristocra and I can meet you at the edge of the starship graveyard--there's an Imperial outpost there.
Saganu can fill you in--he likes you, by the way--and we can plan a final approach. Temple out.
Saganu can fill you in, and we can plan a final approach. Temple out.
Agent? You're in position. Burn a hole through that wall and feed in the camera.
Getting a call from Zero Station. They've finished analyzing the pirate data.
Agent. Ensign Temple. You do the Defense Force proud.
Agent. Ensign Temple. Your raid was successful.
It seems Admiral Davos has been trying to arrange safe passage through pirate territory to the starship graveyard. The pirates have agreed to meet. Today.
Get me details, and I'll be there.
When and where?
Is that spark in your eye for me, or the operation?
[Flirt] You're enjoying this.
Any new endeavor makes the blood run swift.
Giving away all that heavy equipment must have paid off.
Guess the bribes worked.
All our enemies in one place... that's our opportunity.
We'll slaughter them all.
The admiral may not personally attend. We'll have to play it softly.
The meet is in the primary Marauder base. Heavily fortified--attack head-on, and the attendees slip away.
However, a cave system runs under the base. Move softer than a shadow, and you could tap the cave wall.
You're sending her to the Bone Pits.
You're sending him to the Bone Pits.
The caves are inhabited by animal life and resemble... a slaughterhouse. But it's the perfect place from which to observe the meeting.
I'll need maps and equipment.
Understood.
It won't be a problem.
Keep your men out of it. They almost got me killed in here.
Don't mess up this time.
If that is true, I assure you, those responsible will be punished.
Once you're in place, you can use a laser drill and microcord camera to tap the wall.
My team will be in touch from Zero Station. Good luck to you.
We need to move out, but... be careful in the monster's den.
Are you alright, Ensign?
I'm fine. Check on the others.
Sir. I suppose you want an explanation.
What are you, Ensign? Jedi? Sith?
You can use the Force.
We all have secrets. If you're Force sensitive, it's none of my business.
No explanation required.
I don't like people keeping secrets from me.
This had better be good.
What I did back there--it was a Force trick, sir. I'm just powerful enough to get into trouble.
No lightning, no seeing the future. I never trained...
If the Sith knew, they'd have me killed. That's why I left Imperial service for the Chiss Ascendancy.
For now, we have a job to do. We can deal with the rest another time.
We'll discuss this later.
Yes, sir.
If the Sith knew, you could become one of them.
Why would the Sith hurt you?
Only if I survived the Sith Academy. And I wouldn't.
Our ultimate duty is to the Sith and to the Emperor.
You failed the Empire.
Watch your tone. She just saved our lives.
Please--I know you serve Darth Jadus. But let me finish this job before you judge me.
Please--it's your prerogative to pursue this, of course. But let's finish the job, first.
There's no time for distractions. Proceed.
Duty first, agreed.
Put some faith in me, and this might turn out alright.
I'm not unkind.
You can't escape your fate forever. Remember that.
You'll be dealt with soon.
Take them down!
Kill the Chiss. Save the human for questioning.
Blast you. Stop! Look at me and stop!
Look at her. Everyone, stop.
That's right. Keep looking here. I'll keep talking, and you keep looking....
...sir, if you're going to do anything, do it now!
Temple here. Like we thought, those caches are a gift from Admiral Davos to the pirate coalition.
Specifically, he's paying off a group called the Marauders. Raiders and hijackers, influential with the other pirate gangs.
But what's the reason?
Any idea why?
What do we know about their methods, composition?
Tell me about these Marauders.
Sorry, still reviewing the file. Heavy weapons and frontal assaults, mixed species. I'm... not going to read you what they do to their victims.
Bloody a few noses, and someone will start talking.
Time to smash some heads.
Yes, sir. Discipline it is.
The Marauders have a camp nearby. Guard looks light at the moment. We're going to take a team in.
Meet us there, and we'll dig up some answers. Temple out.
Sir? This is Ensign Temple. Looks like that cache is full of stolen Imperial equipment.
Given how the pirates are guarding it, I'm guessing it's a gift from Admiral Davos to the White Maw.
Where does that leave us?
He's working with the pirates?
Don't tell me you called just to talk about pirates.
[Flirt] Is that all you want?
The Defense Force is surprisingly strict about using their secure channels for personal calls.
Those pirates have military-grade equipment. Not many people can supply that gear.
They're a nasty bunch.
Acknowledged. Even for the White Maw, they do seem overarmed.
I need certainty, or you're wasting my time.
Give me facts, not guesses.
You talk to everyone like that? Sorry, sir--don't say anything.
I advise continuing the recon. A little luck and we'll pin down which White Maw faction the admiral's dealing with.
If you can tag the caches for tracking, that wouldn't hurt either. Temple out.
Not ready to go back outside yet? You should see Hoth in the winter.
How long have you lived here?
Tell me about yourself.
Now, why would you spend a winter here? You should admire snow from a warm bed on Alderaan....
[Flirt] You deserve better....
Or just wait it out in a jungle somewhere. I miss Dromund Kaas.
Hoth has seasons?
Winter? Really?
Two months long. Winter is when your breath freezes on your lips.
I've been on Hoth barely a year. You can imagine that Zero Station gets a little cramped; not that I don't adore the Chiss, but....
... well, they're very generous to put up with me.
Why is a human working in a Chiss base, anyway?
What brought you here?
You don't want to hear that whole story now.
Have my people given you any trouble?
You get along with Chiss well?
Never--though I think Tenabli makes fun of how I pronounce her name. I do try.
I haven't met many Chiss before.
What are the Chiss like?
They're a terribly private people. Noble. And they did make me an ensign.
Anyway, I'm taking too much of your time. We have an admiral to catch, sir.
I'll keep that in mind. For now, Ensign, let's get to work.
I need to go.
Yes, sir. I'll be waiting on those scans.
You say you're with the Defense Force, but you act like an Imperial.
I need to know your loyalties.
I follow orders, sir. Right now, those orders come from Aristocra Saganu.
If I transfer back to the Empire, I'll take orders from someone else. Will that be a problem?
Loyalties are tested in a war like this. Remember that.
We'll see.
You're a good soldier. That's all I needed to know.
No problem.
Thank you, sir.
Be careful, Ensign, or you'll end up on an Intelligence blacklist.
That sounds like treason.
I'll consider your advice, sir. Thank you.
Now, if you don't mind--I should return to work.
You have our frequency. I'll wait for those reconnaissance scans.
My agents have been watching Admiral Davos for months. We became suspicious when he brought in his own crew--officers loyal to him--and covered it with bribes.
Lately, he bought heavy equipment and guns--built an army for his expedition to the starship graveyard. You threatened his control.
A career admiral doesn't commit treason out of the blue.
But what's his plan?
What's his background, his personality?
Give me information on him.
Admiral Davos fought in the original Battle of Hoth and was stranded here for six months in the aftermath.
My father told me stories. Brilliant strategist, never had the connections to become Moff.
If you knew all this, it was your duty to inform the Empire.
You should've told Command.
Doing so would've exposed this base for nothing. The admiral has too many friends; now that he's moving, things are different.
He must be after the graveyard salvage. Prototype technology, military databanks... it could make him unimaginably wealthy.
I won't proceed without Imperial sanction. Grant it, and we can stop Admiral Davos and his plans together.
I'm in. What's our next move?
You have my sanction.
I like you, Aristocra. You're young, smart, professional... we'll make a good team.
[Flirt] Looking forward to it.
I hope you're right. I enjoy a challenging partnership.
I came to Hoth for one thing: a Republic shuttle called the Starbreeze. I need Admiral Davos to find it.
My mission is to find a ship.
I see. Then we share a common interest, at least.
I'm with you... for now.
The White Maw pirates control the wastelands between here and the starship graveyard. The admiral's been sending his people out there for weeks.
My scouting party caught them burying some sort of supply caches.
We don't know what the admiral's caches are for, but if you could get us reconnaissance scans, they might give us a lead on the man himself.
First we learn what he's up to, then we close in.
Agreed.
These drop points--any ideas at all?
Any theories?
Emergency supplies, deliveries to the pirates... we just don't know.
Our priority is finding Admiral Davos, not unraveling his plan.
We should hit him directly.
Then perhaps you'd like to go out and search by hand.
Sorry. This is the best we can do.
These are the drop point locations. Contact me when you get the scans, and we'll find our man. Chiss honor.
No wind chill down here. Start a few fires, and we'll call it home.
What is all this?
Well--as secret bases go, this isn't bad at all.
Sir! Sorry for not contacting you sooner. No one thought Admiral Davos's men would actually start shooting.
Ensign Raina Temple, Chiss Expansionary Defense Force. Welcome to Zero Station.
You're awfully pale for a Chiss.
You're a Chiss ensign?
Yes, sir, but they gave me the rank and I couldn't say no to the uniform.
Warmth on Hoth at last. A pleasure to meet you, Ensign.
[Flirt] Hello there.
I know you're just saying that, because I'm practically frostbitten. Come on, I'll show you around.
Good to meet you, Ensign. Even under... unusual circumstances.
Thank you.
We'll have to talk later; it's been ages since I've seen anything but snow on this world.
You too, sir. I'm not complaining, but it's been a while since I saw a human face.
Since I arrived on Hoth, I've been lied to, marked for death and nearly frozen. I want an explanation.
Tell me what's going on.
I plan to give you one, sir. Along with a heating pack; you do look a bit chilled.
This is a top secret Chiss Ascendancy installation. Self-sufficient, running in parallel with the aboveground outposts. Paranoia at work.
But our "paranoia" paid off.
And this is our base commander, Aristocra Saganu.
It's an honor to have you with us, despite the situation with Admiral Davos. Welcome home.
It's good to be among friends, sir.
My pleasure.
You have the ensign to thank, you know. It isn't the homeworld, but she was instrumental in bringing you here.
I am an Imperial officer, not a lost child of the Ascendancy.
My loyalty is to the Empire.
Then it's true our blood begins to thin.
Stop it. None of this matters right now.
Very well. To business.
Ensign Temple speaks highly of Imperial Intelligence. She convinced me the Admiral Davos situation warranted bringing you in.
He ordered his men to torture me. I'd like to know why.
The admiral tried to kill me.
You've had this hidden base all along?
What is this place?
Zero Station was originally a deep space listening post. When the war came to the Hoth system, we kept it a secret.
It's served the Defense Force well. No Imperial has ever set foot inside.
I'll make sure the facility stays secure.
Your secret is safe.
It's served the Defense Force well. You're the first Imperial to know of its existence.
I appreciate your trust, and I don't intend to expose you.
Your secret is safe.
Then we should begin the true work.
Isn't she Imperial?
What about Ensign Temple?
I'm not at liberty to discuss Ensign Temple's situation. Suffice it to say, she is a valued member of our unit.
Perhaps we should move on. The mission...
This is a military resource the Empire should control.
You've kept too much from us.
The Chiss Ascendancy is a willing ally of the Empire. We are not slaves.
I think this discussion can wait.
Quite. To the matter at hand.
Next time, call me before my life is in danger.
You're a little late to help.
I admit, the timing was poor. But I'll tell you what I know.
Can I help you, sir?
Thank you, sir. I can tell you a little, but... it'll wait.
Chiss? I don't think so.
